pr_title: Add project version into the subject line of the emails

timeline.message: refactor: Update EmailChannel to include project version in email subject line
refactor: Handle test case where SubTopic is null

timeline.bodyText: I don't think we need to check this. We know that the sub-topic is the project-version for Black Duck and if there is ever another provider, it will be likely that we need to include this for feature parity.
timeline.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: A license limit notification won't include a version unless I'm mistaken. The API of ProviderMessageContent doesn't make it clear that the sub topic is the version so given that API I suggested filtering to be sure you have the project version sub topic.  The initial code just had find first.  But with your suggestion to join the sub topics the filtering may not make sense anymore.  If we remove the filter portion of the stream then I would like to see a comment above that states we're assuming the sub-topic is the version.   Just in case we get a bug later on that the subject isn't correct we have a comment to refresh our memory on the assumption in case it comes into play.
replies.author: psantos1113

timeline.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: In my testing of this feature I saw that for multiple versions we have multiple emails for each. So "projectA version1" and "projectA version2" would come in as 2 separate emails with those titles. Is there a case where they would be combined?
replies.author: ChomickiM

replies.bodyText: I believe they are supposed to be combined if they get processed in the same batch of notifications.
replies.author: gkillough

timeline.bodyText:
We might want to consider truncating this if it exceeds a certain number of characters.
78 is the suggested number of RCF 2822 https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2822#section-2.1.1
timeline.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: StringUtils should have the abbreviate method if I remember correctly to do that.
replies.author: psantos1113
